messages.content: How effective was the Great Wall of China in keeping rabbits out of the country?

The Great Wall of China was not very effective in keeping rabbits out of the country. It was built during the Ming dynasty, and rabbits are much smaller than the wall's height. Also, rabbits are able to climb and burrow through the wall, so it was actually a poor barrier to rabbits.
So it failed in its intended purpose?
Yes, that's correct. The Great Wall of China wasn't very effective in keeping rabbits out.
Why didn't they demolish it then?
The Great Wall of China was not demolished because it was a symbol of Chinese history and culture. It was also used to control the movement of people and goods.
